answerText: Ben Jonson[10] Jonson also wrote lyrics such as "Drink to me only with thine eyes" in a group of poems addressed to this woman.
heading: Terrapin |2013 | Ike Jose + Tanay Kothari | 8 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: He wrote "Farewell, thou child of my right hand, and joy; my sin was too much hope of thee, lov'd boy." For 10 points each: [10] Identify this English poet of "On My First Son," also known for saying "I loved the man, and do honour his memory on this side idolatry as much as any" when referring to Shakespeare in his book Timber.
